title: 25-year-old woman ID'd as victim in South Flores shooting that injured 4 others
content:
SAN ANTONIO — The Bexar County Medical Examiner’s Office identified a woman who was shot and killed Sunday morning on the South Side.
Carla Julisa Rogue Valeriano, 25, died from multiple gunshot wounds in a homicide that occurred at about 2:30 a.m. Sunday near the 2600 block of South Flores Street near Pruitt Avenue.
A sedan pulled up to the scene and three suspects exited the vehicle. The suspects approached the victims and began shooting, hitting all five, according to police at the scene.
The shooting occurred in a parking lot across the street from a night club, with Club Kah-Lua being in the vicinity. However, police did not say if the five people shot were at the club before the shooting.
The victims were found in various locations near the original shooting location, police said.
Rogue Valeriano was transported in critical condition to San Antonio Military Medical Center, where she later died, according to a previous report.
The other four male victims were transported to University Hospital in varying conditions ranging from stable to critical.
Police had no suspects or motive at the time of the shooting.
Anyone with information regarding the crime is asked to contact Crime Stoppers at 210-224-7867.
Police have yet to release more details on the incident but this story will be updated as soon as more information is available.
